chapters.title: Product Design and Planning
chapters.summary: This chapter covers tokenomics, tokenization, token warrants, compliance-by-design, computable contracts, legal architectures for Web3 projects on Solana, DAOs, and exploring offshore jurisdictions. It provides a foundation for building successful and legally sound crypto projects.

chapters.title: Token Typologies
chapters.summary: This chapter explores different types of tokens, including those used in Web3 games, SocialFi, DePIN, and DeFi. It provides practical guidance for understanding and utilizing various token models.

chapters.title: Setting up for Success and Risk Mitigation
chapters.summary: This chapter focuses on navigating the legal and regulatory landscape for crypto projects in the UK. It covers AML regulations, FCA registration and authorization, electronic money regulations, and sanctions.

chapters.title: UK Regulation of the Financial Promotion of Cryptoassets
chapters.summary: This chapter provides an overview of the UK's regulatory framework for promoting cryptoassets. It explains the rules and requirements for marketing crypto-related products and services.

chapters.title: Tax and Accounting
chapters.summary: This chapter covers tax and accounting considerations for crypto projects. It provides guidance on tax implications, accounting practices, and relevant regulations.

chapters.title: Tracing, Freezing, and Recovery
chapters.summary: This chapter focuses on the legal and practical aspects of recovering stolen crypto assets. It covers tracing techniques, legal procedures, and strategies for asset recovery.

chapters.title: You're Off - Token Launch
chapters.summary: This chapter provides a comprehensive guide to launching a token. It covers legal considerations, marketing strategies, and practical steps for a successful token launch.

chapters.title: The Importance of Community and Web3 Accelerators
chapters.summary: This chapter highlights the role of community building and Web3 accelerators in supporting crypto projects. It discusses the benefits of community engagement and accelerator programs.

chapters.title: Gambling & Web3
chapters.summary: This section discusses how elements of chance combined with cryptoassets in Web3 games can trigger gambling regulations. It covers betting and lotteries in the context of Web3, emphasizing the need for skill-based mechanics and careful design to avoid legal issues.

chapters.title: Out of Scope: Free Draws & Prize Competitions
chapters.summary: This brief chapter explains that Free Draws and Prize Competitions, unlike betting and lotteries, fall outside the Gambling Act's scope. It highlights, however, the importance of aligning with the legal definitions to avoid inadvertently triggering gambling regulations.

chapters.title: SocialFi: Boosting Organic User Growth with SocialFi
chapters.summary: This section advocates for community-driven growth in Web3 rather than relying solely on financial incentives. It explores SocialFi campaigns and user engagement, suggesting ways to cultivate a dedicated and loyal community.

chapters.title: DePIN
chapters.summary: This chapter discusses Decentralised Physical Infrastructure Networks (DePINs) and their potential to disrupt the cloud computing oligopoly. It explores the legal and contractual implications of DePINs, particularly regarding ownership, liability, and data protection.

chapters.title: Practical Guide for DeFi Developers
chapters.summary: This guide focuses on the legal and regulatory considerations for DeFi developers in the UK. It provides practical advice on navigating jurisdictional issues, designing permissionless protocols, and creating user interfaces while minimizing legal risks.

chapters.title: Setting Up for Success and Risk Mitigation
chapters.summary: This chapter offers an overview of AML, Sanctions, and Compliance Law relevant to crypto projects in the UK. It covers key frameworks like the MLRs, FSMA authorization, and the Sanctions regime, emphasizing the need for robust AML controls and sanctions policies.

chapters.title: UK Regulation of the Financial Promotion of Cryptoassets
chapters.summary: This section details the UK's regulatory framework for marketing cryptoassets, focusing on the Financial Promotion Order (FPO). It explains the restrictions and exemptions related to financial promotions, highlighting the need for compliance and the potential consequences of non-compliance.

chapters.title: Tax, VAT, and Accounting
chapters.summary: This chapter outlines the tax implications for crypto projects in the UK. It covers key tax considerations for different business structures, the tax treatment of crypto income and gains, and the importance of compliance with HMRC regulations.

chapters.title: Tracing, Freezing and Recovery - When Crypto Assets are Stolen
chapters.summary: This section explains the process of recovering stolen crypto assets. It emphasizes the importance of immediate action, reporting to law enforcement, and engaging legal professionals or blockchain investigators to trace and freeze assets through court procedures.

chapters.title: Youâ€™re Off Token Launch
chapters.summary: This chapter offers practical advice on launching a token, focusing on legal compliance and community building. It discusses strategies for navigating regulatory hurdles, managing a community, and creating a compelling whitepaper and marketing campaign.

chapters.title: The Importance of Community and Web3 Accelerators
chapters.summary: This concluding section emphasizes the importance of community and Web3 accelerators for crypto projects. It highlights the value of support, collaboration, and shared learning in navigating the complex Web3 landscape.
